thread.title: Michigan, NY artists win $200,000 grand prizes at ArtPrize
thread.title_full: Michigan, NY artists win $200,000 grand prizes at ArtPrize

title: Michigan, NY artists win $200,000 grand prizes at ArtPrize
text:
Michigan, NY artists win $200,000 grand prizes at ArtPrize   9, 2015 at 10:00 PM   9, 2015 at 10:00 PM EDT 
GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. (AP) â€” A northern Michigan textile artist has won a $200,000 grand prize at Michigan's seventh annual ArtPrize competition. 
Ann Loveless and husband Steven Loveless, a photographer, won the public vote Friday for "Northwood Awakening," a large photo print and quilt hybrid. It depicts a serene woodland panorama. 
Ann Loveless also won in 2013. The couple live in Beulah, Michigan. 
Separately, a jury of experts awarded a $200,000 grand prize to Kate Gilmore of New York for "Higher Ground." She transformed a former Grand Rapids convent into performance art, with women on swings in open windows. 
Awards totaling $100,000 were given to other winners in certain categories. There were 1,550 eligible works at ArtPrize, some from as far away as Italy.
